intro: Harpullia pedicellaris, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Harpullia pedicellaris is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates.
